edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.ot.otBatch.semiHonest

Class OTSemiHonestDDHBatchOnByteArraySender

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.ot.otBatch.semiHonest.OTSemiHonestDDHBatchOnByteArraySender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OTBatchSender, ProtocolSecLevel, SecurityLevel, SemiHonest

    public class OTSemiHonestDDHBatchOnByteArraySender
extends java.lang.Object
implements SemiHonest
    Concrete class for batch Semi-Honest OT assuming DDH sender ON BYTE ARRAY.

    This class derived from OTSenderDDHSemiHonestAbs and implements the functionality related to the byte array inputs.

    The pseudo code of this protocol can be found in Protocol 5.1 of pseudo codes document at http://cryptobiu.github.io/scapi/SDK_Pseudocode.pdf.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

    • Method Detail

      • transfer

        public OTBatchSOutput transfer(Channel channel,
                      OTBatchSInput input)
                        throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                               java.io.IOException
        Runs the transfer phase of the protocol.

        "WAIT for message (h0i,h1i) from R

        SAMPLE a single random value r <- {0, . . . , q-1} and COMPUTE u=g^r

        For every i=1,...,m, COMPUTE:

        * ki0 = (hi0)^r

        * ki1 = (hi1)^r

        In the byte array scenario:

        * vi0 = xi0 XOR KDF(|xi0|,ki0)

        * vi1 = xi1 XOR KDF(|xi1|,ki1)

        In the group element scenario:

        * vi0 = xi0 * ki0

        * vi1 = xi1 * ki1

        For every i=1,...,m, SEND (u,vi0,vi1) to R

        OUTPUT nothing"

        Specified by:
        transfer in interface OTBatchSender
        Parameters:
        channel - each call should get a different one.
        input - The parameters given in the input must match the DlogGroup member of this class, which given in the constructor.
        Returns:
        null, this protocol has no output.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if there was a problem during serialization mechanism.
        java.io.IOException - if there was a problem during a communication phase.
